holidays.name: National Cream-Filled Donut Day
holidays.description: A delightful day dedicated to celebrating those irresistible donuts filled with creamy goodness inside, from vanilla custard to chocolate cream!
holidays.origin: This day is celebrated informally by donut lovers and bakeries across the U.S., though no official proclamation exists; it's a sweet excuse to indulge!
holidays.funFact: Cream-filled donuts were originally popularized in the early 20th century as a luxurious pastry treat, making today the perfect excuse to embrace sweet decadence.

holidays.name: National Coloring Day
holidays.description: A day encouraging people of all ages to break out the crayons, colored pencils, or markers and get creative with coloring for relaxation and fun.
holidays.origin: Founded by the Crayola company to celebrate creativity, mindfulness, and art in a simple, fun way.
holidays.funFact: Coloring isn‚Äôt just for kids ‚Äî it‚Äôs known to reduce stress and anxiety in adults, making this a bizarrely therapeutic holiday!

holidays.name: Eat an Extra Dessert Day
holidays.description: The perfect excuse to toss dietary rules out the window and enjoy an additional dessert after your usual meal ‚Äî no guilt allowed!
holidays.origin: This unofficial, food-themed holiday became popular on social media as a fun way to 'reward' oneself mid-September.
holidays.funFact: Studies show that a little indulgence now and then can boost mood and satisfaction, so this holiday might actually be good for you!
